explains: v. 使负罪；连累（incriminate 的现在分词）

sentences.en: They were afraid of answering the questions and incriminating themselves.
sentences.cn: 他们担心因回答这些问题而受到牵连。

sentences.en: Police had reportedly searched his house and found incriminating evidence.
sentences.cn: 据报道，警察搜查了他的房子，并且发现了罪证。

sentences.en: Of those who admitted cheating, 65 percent had been caught out by their mobile, with a third saying their partner had read incriminating text messages.
sentences.cn: 在那些承认欺骗伴侣的人中，65%被手机上的内容被出卖，其中三分之一的人说伴侣看见了他们发送的“有罪”短信。
